modules.title: Java 3x3 TTT
modules.subtitle: Learn the basics of a Java CLI app
outputs: A basic 3x3 TTT
100% code coverage
Human vs Computer
If possible, unbeatable
outcomes: Basic understanding of static typing
Understand how a Java project is structured

modules.title: Java 4x4 performance
modules.subtitle: Learn the basics of a Java CLI app
outputs: A TTT that responds to all user input in less than 2sec.
A blog post detailing what bottlenecks were found and how.

modules.title: Java Echo Server
modules.subtitle: What are Sockets and why do they matter?
outputs: A server app that will echo any message sent over a socket
A client app that will send its input to the server
outcomes: Understand sockets and how to separate your app from them

modules.title: Java Chat server
modules.subtitle: Talking should be a fun exercise.
outputs: A single app that can be started and connected to a second instance of itself
Both apps should be take and display text like a regular chat
outcomes: Deeper understanding of Sockets for back and forth communication
AUndstand how to abstract away from IO

modules.title: Java koans
modules.subtitle: Basic syntax of the language
outputs: All passing koans from https://github.com/matyb/java-koans
A blog post highlighting a different between Java and a previously known language
outcomes: Basic undstanding of the language, covering functions, classes, types

modules.title: Java Guilded Rose
modules.subtitle: Refactoring and pattern matching
outputs: A repo with a refactored Guilded Rose
A blog post highlighting which SOLID principles your solution adheres to
A git history showing the refactoring-steps taken
outcomes: Understanding the practicality of the SOLID principles
An appreciation for refactoring techniques
An appreciation for a workflow that allows you to alwasy 'stay green'

modules.title: Java HTTP server
modules.subtitle: A challenge to be experienced!
outputs: A server which passes all CobSpec tests
A repository with high-quality code that you'd be happy to show fellow crafters
Be prepared to moderate a 15min Q&A about the server and your approach
outcomes: A sense for code-design for a project resembling real-life.
Appretiation for trade-offs that need to be taken balancing time and deliverables.
